meanings.definition: Of or relating to a chorus or choir.
meanings.sent1: The enchoric voices of the choir filled the hall with harmonious melodies.
meanings.sent2: The enchoric performance by the choir captivated the audience with its unity.
meanings.sent3: The enchoric choir members wore matching outfits, creating a visually appealing sight.
meanings.sent4: The enchoric harmony of the choir was like a symphony of unity and togetherness.
meanings.sent5: The enchoric singing of the choir echoed through the church, leaving a lasting impression on all who listened.

meanings.definition: Pertaining to a type of poetry or drama performed by a chorus.
meanings.sent1: The enchoric verses of the play were beautifully recited by the chorus.
meanings.sent2: The enchoric elements in the poetry added depth and emotion to the performance.
meanings.sent3: The enchoric drama unfolded on stage, captivating the audience with its poetic charm.
meanings.sent4: The enchoric poetry danced off the pages, enchanting all who heard it.
meanings.sent5: The enchoric performance of the play by the chorus brought the ancient words to life in a mesmerizing way.

meanings.definition: Involving or characteristic of a group singing or chanting together.
meanings.sent1: The enchoric singing at the campfire brought everyone together in a joyous melody.
meanings.sent2: The enchoric chanting of the fans created a powerful sense of unity in the stadium.
meanings.sent3: The enchoric group singing competition was filled with laughter and camaraderie.
meanings.sent4: The enchoric voices of the children blended harmoniously in the school choir.
meanings.sent5: The enchoric chanting of the monks resonated through the monastery, creating a peaceful atmosphere.
